intro: Tripterospermum japonicum var. albiflorum, commonly known as the white-flowered Japanese tripterospermum, is a flowering plant native to Japan. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its showy, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant has lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy texture and grows as a shrub, often reaching heights of up to 1 meter. It thrives in well-drained soil and partial shade, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardens. Its botanical features make it a valuable subject for both horticultural study and ecological research.
